intro: Senecio calyculatus, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Senecio calyculatus is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
